newsitem.title: INDIA: ICICI ties up with Prudential.
newsitem.headline: ICICI ties up with Prudential.

text.p: Indian term-lender, the Industrial Credit and Investment Corp of India Ltd (ICICI), said on Thursday it has tied up with the U.K's Prudential Corp to form an asset management joint venture.

"ICICI today signed an MoU (Memorandum of Understanding) with Prudential Corp for Prudential to enter as a joint venture partner in ICICI Asset Management Co. Ltd (I-AMC) subject to the statutory and regulatory approvals," ICICI said in a statement.
I-AMC manages two schemes with total assets of 1.56 billion rupees on behalf of more than 300,000 investors, it added.

"The entry of Prudential as a new joint venture partner in I-AMC will bring a renewed focus to the positioning of its mutual funds schemes as attractive investment opportunities for individual investors," the statement quoted ICICI CEO K.V. Kamath as saying.
Prudential Corp will take the place of American investment banker J P Morgan and Co Inc, which has withdrawn from the venture under a restructuring agreement with ICICI, it said.

"We see India as integral to our global strategy and are excited to be part of India's long-term development in partnership with ICICI," the statement quoted Mark Tucker, managing director for Prudential Corp Asia, as saying.
